instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Air 2015, 820 00165 A, keyboard/touchpad works only pre-login (liquid damage)
threads.message:
Hi again and Happy New Year!

The same unit that had a backlight issue. ([URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/43680-macbook-air-2015-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a-no-backlight-following-liquid-damage"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/for...-liquid-damage[/URL])
Just got the password from the client. on login screen both touchpad and keyboard work perfectly
The moment I log in, they are gone.
I am hoping it is a common issue

Edit: tried safe mode, no keyboard/touchpad even on the login screen :/

threads.title: MacBook Air 2015, 820 00165 A, keyboard/touchpad works only pre-login (liquid damage)
threads.message:
Is not common fail.
Trackapad communicates with PCH through USB before login into OSX.
Once logged in, communication is done through SPI bus.
Check al <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>-03 resistors and voltages for <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>.

threads.title: MacBook Air 2015, 820 00165 A, keyboard/touchpad works only pre-login (liquid damage)
threads.message:
Thank you [B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL][/B]

<RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR> 33.4 ohm
<RESISTOR>R4851</RESISTOR> 33.6 ohm
<RESISTOR>R4852</RESISTOR> 33.3 ohm
<RESISTOR>R4853</RESISTOR> 33.3 ohm

The resistors seem fine I guess

<CHIP>U4810</CHIP>

1 3.33v
2 3.30v
3 0v
4 gnd
5 3.33v
6 0v
7 3.33v
8 3.33v

Measurements taken with only power and the fan connected

threads.title: MacBook Air 2015, 820 00165 A, keyboard/touchpad works only pre-login (liquid damage)
threads.message:
You must take voltages for <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> before and after logged in...
Then compare how react its inputs and outputs.

threads.title: MacBook Air 2015, 820 00165 A, keyboard/touchpad works only pre-login (liquid damage)
threads.message:
[B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL]
Thank you![/B]
As I started to look into ways I can check the voltages while running the os, I noticed that the issue is with the flex cable (touchpad to mobo). I had a similar unit - new flex fixed it

Thanks again!
